Deficiency Narrative: A first aid was not found during this inspection.
An incident report was reported to the hotline 2 days after the incident happened.
Correction Narrative: CEO Raphael Solawon stated they will be adding more detail to incident reports to ensure all information about how long incidents take and/or extend, and information of when it's reported to the hotline is included in future cases.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple children advised of being hit by staff.
The purpose of this rule is to prevent harm to children from risks associated with fire in the facility.
Correction Narrative: Fire extinguishers were serviced/inspected, and tags updated.  Executive director will do monthly walkthrough.

Deficiency Narrative: Damaged doors & window blinds, broken furniture, and wall stains were observed.
Correction Narrative: Window blind has been changed. Staff were also reminded to complete Maintenance request when they notice maintenance need. Executive director would also do monthly walkthrough.

Deficiency Narrative: Records reviewed showed clerical errors.
Correction Narrative:
Corrective Action Plan: All staffs have been retrained on our AWOL policy and how to accurately document such incidents. We would also monitor these documentations. 
The MAR has been reviewed to ensure all required information are on there.

Deficiency Narrative: Records reviewed show staff did not renew annual trainings timely.
Correction Narrative: Corrective Action Plan: We would review staff files and set reminders for when trainings are coming due and follow up with staffs to get them done timely.

Deficiency Narrative: Children reported that one direct staff yelled at the residence, and threatened to hit the residence.
Correction Narrative:
5/11/24: Email received advised that staff was coached on the appropriate verbiage to use while interacting with the children in care.

5/16/24: The residence were interviewed and there were no concerns for physical discipline, staff cursing or yelling at the children.

Deficiency Narrative: It was determined that a caregiver did not intervene when there was an altercation between three residents.
Correction Narrative: An in-person follow-up inspection was conducted on 01/19/2024. Please see inspection number 3984807. Multiple children were interviewed and stated staff members intervene timely to incidents at the operation. They also stated there are adequate staff members present with them at all times. Two child files and one staff file was reviewed at the inspection and there were no concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: 3 out of 3 staff files reviewed did contain proof of education.
Correction Narrative: The operation e-mailed the staffs proof of education and stated they will ensure staff's proof of education will be in their staff file.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to report sexual abuse against a child in care by another resident.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent a statement stating they will ensure to report all sexual aggression incidents to the required entities.

Deficiency Narrative:
Condition 1: Condition Met/Partially Due
Condition 2: Condition Met
Condition 3: not due
Condition 4:  Condition Met

Per condition 1 and condition 5, the operation was supposed to provide documentation to Licensing by 9/1/2022. This documentation was received late on 9/8/2022 and 9/13/2022.

Condition 1: not due
Condition 2: not due

The operation did not provide all required documentation to meet the condition regarding physical site repairs (Condition 6). The operation has not provided a sufficient plan to meet the requirements of Condition 6, a physical site tracking log, and other documentation.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent an email that contained their physical site tracking log, action plan, maintenance request form and checklist to satisfy condition #6.

Deficiency Narrative:
Condition 1: not due
Condition 2: not due
Condition 3: not due
Condition 4:  Condition Met
Condition 5: not due
Condition 6: Deficient/not met
Condition 7: Deficient/not met

The operation did not have the probation notice posted near the entrance or anywhere in the operation. This was corrected once it was brought to the Director and Administrator's attention. Condition 7 states that the Administrator must submit to RCCR by 5:00 p.m. each Friday his/her schedule for the following week. The operation has not been providing their schedule by 5:00pm each Friday. Instead, it has been provided after the deadline at various times. 
The operation did not provide all required documentation to  meet the condition  regarding physical site repairs (Condition 6). The operation also did not provide it once it was developed.
Operation failed to send the required 14-day planning review notice in a timely manner.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent an email stating, "This notice was required within 7 days but we missed the standard being updated to 14 days. We have since started giving 14 days notice."

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to report multiple serious incidents to licensing.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent an email stating, "We have since implemented reporting serious incident reports within 24hrs."

Deficiency Narrative: During review of medication records -A.H. On 1/11/22 and 1/26/2022 Dr. Thompson did a medication review for the child and he was prescribed Trazodone 100 mg 1 tab @ PM (PRN). Medication log reviewed for January shows the staff incorrectly wrote the wrong strength. On 2/8/2022 Dr. Thompson did a medication review for the child and changed the Trazodone 100mg to 50mg 1 tab @ PM (PRN). February and March Medication log shows the staff gave the correct dosage and strength for the child.
Correction Narrative: The agency responded on today with the corrections once they were made aware it wasn't sent but they were aware about the citation and made corrections for it not to occur in the future. An email of a new structed form was created to implement mistakes from being made with the client's information and any changes that should occur by the doctor and pharmacy.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver displayed a lack of self -control when he punched a hole in a wall.
Correction Narrative: On 8/8/22 the administrator sent an email in response to the citation. The administrator stated the staff in question was coached and has been terminated. The rest of the team were also trained on self control  as well as all new hires.

Deficiency Narrative: Several medication records reviewed were missing the reason the medication was prescribed.
Correction Narrative: The operation stated they will be sure to include this information going forward and will update the records as needed.

Deficiency Narrative: There is a hole in a wall in the children's bedroom downstairs. The restroom downstairs has strong urine ordor.

Staff recorded an exchange between an adult asking a child what day the incident occurred, the child says that he believes it occurred on a Friday, and is then asked how he was "scratched" and then the adult says that "he scratches himself, then why are you saying they scratched you."
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a corrective action plan stating, "moving forward, all children in care will be discouraged from discussing any ongoing investigation with staff."

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver slammed a child in care to the ground as a form of discipline which caused the child physical pain.
Correction Narrative: The director stated although he does not believe the allegations are true, the staff in question is no longer employed at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver failed to adhere to the child's rights to be free of abuse, neglect, and exploitation as defined in Texas Family Code 261.401 when the caregiver put a child in care at risk of physical harm when he slammed the child to the ground.
Correction Narrative: The director stated although he does not believe the allegations are true, the staff in question is no longer employed at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the bedrooms smelled of urine.
Correction Narrative: The Director stated all rooms have been cleaned.

Deficiency Narrative: 1 of the 6 children's medication records reviewed contained medication errors and there was no documentation of the errors.

All residents interviewed stated they have either been hit by the staff or witnessed the staff hit another resident. Also, a staff stated they have heard the same staff yell at children in care and 3 of the 4 children interviewed stated the staff yells at them./Operation need to provide corrective action plan

Personal restraint documentation reviewed states that a prone restraint was performed on a child in care but it does not indicate it was used as a transitional hold./Operation need to provide corrective action plan
One personal restraint documentation reviewed stated a child in care was restrained in the prone position for 5 minutes/Operation need to provide corrective action plan.
During the walk through it was observed that the 1st floor master bathroom was missing 4 light bulbs over the sink.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent a picture of the master bathroom with all 4 lights.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver placed a child in a closet as a method of discipline.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent an email stating they had an inservice about the operation's discipline policy with the staff.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver  used hitting as a method of discipline.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent an email stating they had an inservice about the operation's discipline policy with the staff.

Deficiency Narrative: All residents interviewed stated they have either been hit by the staff or witnessed the staff hit another resident. Also, a staff stated they have heard the same staff yell at children in care and 3 of the 4 children interviewed stated the staff yells at them.
2 of the 3 staff files reviewed did not have a record of a TB screening
One personal restraint documentation reviewed stated a child in care was restrained in the prone position for 5 minutes
Medication record documentation states that a child in care was administered 2 separate medications that belonged to another person.
Personal restraint documentation reviewed states that a prone restraint was performed on a child in care but it does not indicate it was used as a transitional hold.
Staff did not demonstrate prudent judgment when 2 residents were administered medications after the medications had been discontinued by the provider.
Correction Narrative: The operation stated when the medication errors occurred, there was a new staff that just didn't do so well with paying attention to detail. The staff was let go.

Deficiency Narrative: Several children's medication records reviewed shows that a children missed at least 1 dosage of medication. Also, a child's record reviewed shows that a child in care was not receiving the correct medication dosage.
Correction Narrative: The director stated they have been double and triple checking the medication logs to ensure there are no more mistakes and missed dosages. He has also created a log for staff to keep up with refills.

Deficiency Narrative: Several child records shows that children missed at least 1 dosage and there is no documentation as to why.
Correction Narrative: The director stated he and the administrator have been working to ensure these mistakes do not happen again. He is in constant contact with the pharmacy to ensure medications are refilled on time.

Deficiency Narrative: 1 medication record reviewed was missing the time the medication was administered and the staff's initial/signature.
Correction Narrative: The director stated all staff have been retrained on medications so he's not sure why there keeps being errors but he has had a meeting with his staff regarding the medications.

Deficiency Narrative: 2 medication records reviewed shows that medication was not disposed of after being discontinued.
Correction Narrative: The operation stated when the medication errors occurred, there was a new staff that just didn't do so well with paying attention to detail. The staff was let go.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk through it was observed that the 1st floor master bathroom was missing 4 light bulbs over the sink.

During the walk through at the operation it was observed that the bathrooms upstairs and downstairs had a urine smell. The backyard had a a pile of (10) rocks right outside the door (photos taken).  The walls of the operation have writing through out the operation/home.  12/22 was provided due to the walls and writing.
Correction Narrative: A walkthrough was conducted and the hole in the backyard was observed to be filled in with dirt and the rocks were gone. The urine smell was also gone from the bathrooms.

Deficiency Narrative: The thermometer in the refrigerator was above 40 degrees (photo taken).  Additionally, during the walk through the deep freezer stored in the garage did not have a thermometer.  The Freezer attached to the refrigerator did not have a thermometer (photo taken).
Correction Narrative: A walkthrough was conducted and a thermometer was observed in the refrigerator.

Deficiency Narrative: 3 children described restraints with their hands behind their back and being placed on their stomachs, 2 of the children stated that this is how restraints are done. 1 staff member stated that restraints were done with hands behind their backs. A different staff stated that she placed one of the childrens hands behind their back to retrieve a comb. The child stated that he was on the floor with his hands behind his back.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent an email stating they have had an in-service about proper restraints with staff.

Deficiency Narrative: 2 caregivers used corporal punishment on children in care when they punched the child/ren.
Correction Narrative: Both staff are no longer working at the operation. The operation has majority new staff and has ensured that all staff are trained.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregivers failed to adhere to the child's rights to be free of abuse, neglect, and exploitation as defined in Texas Family Code 261.401 when 2 caregivers caused physical harm and injury to children in care.
Correction Narrative: The operation has retrained all staff. Both staff are no longer working at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: The child-care administrator failed to provide oversight of staffing patterns, which resulted in the systematic failure, which in turn facilitated the physical abuse of a child in care by a caregiver that was previously believed to have physically abused a child in care before.
Correction Narrative: Both staff are no longer working at the operation. The operation has majority new staff and has ensured that all staff are trained.

Deficiency Narrative: 3 of the 3 children interviewed stated that a staff member pinches and pulls on the residents.
Correction Narrative: The director stated the staff has been removed from the schedule.

Deficiency Narrative: During initial walkthrough the refrigerator contained no food of substance, when addressed, staff stated the residents were having left over from the day before, there was no food cooking and only a cake in the refrigerator.
Correction Narrative: The refrigerator was observed to be filled with different foods. There is a separate refrigerator/freezer in the garage that has a variety of food.

Deficiency Narrative: While conducting interviews, children stated they are allowed to play shooting games. During the walkthrough, a PS4 was observed with video games rated MA and 17. These are not appropriate to the children's needs.
Correction Narrative: During my inspection, the video games were not present.

Deficiency Narrative: It was learned during an interview at the children's school that a child in care arrived to school wearing a female's blouse. All residents at the operation are boys. The school provided the child with a change of clothing.
Correction Narrative: During a walkthrough of the operation, I looked at the children's clothing. There were no concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: A new staff member is not documenting his name and signature on the medication records.
Correction Narrative: The operation stated via email that this is a new employee and that this employee has since been retrained on medication records.

Deficiency Narrative: One restraint report reviewed did not include the type of restraint that was used.
Correction Narrative: The operation stated via email that all staff have been retrained on EBI documentation.

Deficiency Narrative: One child record reviewed did not have a documented TB test.
Correction Narrative: The child is scheduled to have his TB exam Wednesday August 4, 2021.

Deficiency Narrative: Several children's medication records reviewed did not have an accurate count.
Correction Narrative: The operation stated, "MAR and medications will be reviewed weekly for accuracy. All staff also re-trained"

Deficiency Narrative: The operation does not have an overall operation evaluation for emergency behavior interventions.
Correction Narrative:
The operation provided an email stating, " In the year 2020, a total of 10 personal restraints were documented. For the most part,
children were successfully redirected with de-escalation and short personal restraints.
There weren't any incidences of physical injuries or any other negative side effects on
the childs behavior or emotional development resulting from the emergency behavior
interventions. All staff were trained on the safe use of emergency behavior intervention
as well as proper documentation. It was also reinforced that EBI should always be that
resort, staff should always try to de-escalate situations before they get out of hand. The
importance of keeping child(ren) safe during all forms of restraints was also discussed.
All staff are up-to-date with their SAMA training."

Deficiency Narrative: Several children's medication record reviewed showed that children either missed doses of their medication or were not given at the correct time.
Correction Narrative: The operation stated, "MAR and medications will be reviewed weekly for accuracy. All staff also re-trained"

Deficiency Narrative: There was no documentation regarding a post restraint discussion.
Correction Narrative: The operation stated that all staff have been retrained on EBI.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregiver with a pending background check was present at the operation, supervising children and administering medication.
Correction Narrative: As of today, 7/29/2021, CBCU has granted the staff member a provisional with conditions.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver failed to show prudent judgement when she slept while on shift. The caregiver was the only adult at the facility at the time and was responsible for the safety and well being of all the children
Correction Narrative: Has a camera that she uses to check on the staff at night. They're also planning to add a second staff to night shift. The staff is no longer on shift. The staff is no longer employed here.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver failed to adhere to the child's rights to be free of abuse, neglect, and exploitation as defined in Texas Family Code 261.401 when the caregiver failed to properly supervise the children due to sleeping while on shift.
Correction Narrative: The operation stated the particular staff in question is no longer employed at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: The permit holder failed to ensure compliance with minimum standards and rules and also failed to follow the conditions of a safety plan.
Correction Narrative: The operation stated that since receiving this citation they have been on stop of safety plans and ensuring they are being followed.

Deficiency Narrative: CCI was unable to retrieve or view records while at the operation. Also, requested documentation was not immediately available.
Correction Narrative: I spoke to Director Raphael Solawon via telephone regarding the deficiency. He stated his treatment director was supposed to be at the operation to assist. He stated going forward he will ensure records are always available for review when he's not available at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: While at the operation, CCI heard staff yelling and cursing at and in the presence of children.
Correction Narrative: I had a phone conversation with Director Raphael Solawon, he stated he spoke to the employee about this behavior, and although the employee denied using profane language, he stated he would ensure it did not happen again.

Deficiency Narrative: There is a white shelf in one of the residents closets  downstairs that has a broken bottom shelf and the side is cracked as well. There is a basketball goal in the backyard that has a broken backboard, with sharp pieces of hard plastic surrounded the frame of the backboard.
During a walk though of the facility 2 out of the 4 bathrooms observed had toilets that where filthy and bathrooms held really strong urine odors.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent pictures via email of the corrected deficiencies.

Deficiency Narrative: There were 5 medication records missing for 3 children in care. There was no way to confirm that the medication was administrated.
Correction Narrative: "All staff have been re-trained on proper documentation of medication whether given or not. A bi-weekly audit of the MAR will also be conducted."

Deficiency Narrative: While reviewing medication records it was determined that 4 children did not receive their medication because the refills were not made in a timely manner. As a result, medication was not administered daily as instructed. There was also 1 child who did not receive the correct dosage, the medication was to be given once a day but was given twice a day by staff. .
Correction Narrative:
"All staff have been trained to notify the treatment team whenever a child is left with less 10 days supply of any medication to allow an ample time for refill. A bi-weekly audit of the MAR and
medication supply would also be done as a backup for this."

Deficiency Narrative: From medication records it was determined that 2 children were given medication that was discontinued.
Correction Narrative:
"The medication storage was reviewed and reorganized to ensure that all discontinued
medications are immediately separated from current/active medications. The MAR will also be
kept up-to-date in compliance with the Med review."

Deficiency Narrative: EBI documentation stated that a prone restraint was used on a child in care.
Correction Narrative: Staff have been educated on how to document correctly.

Deficiency Narrative: During a visit at the operation, CCI observed an electric saw sitting just outside the front door of the operation.
Correction Narrative: A follow up inspection was conducted at the operation. There were no dangerous tools or items left out. The Executive Director stated he has been making sure to tell contractors not to leave their tools laying around.

Deficiency Narrative: Several staff stated the night shift pops out the 8am medication at night and the staff on day shift administers them.
Correction Narrative: The Executive Director stated he had a meeting with his staff and advised them that they can no longer pop the medication out at night for the morning shift to administer.

Deficiency Narrative: All windows in the bedrooms and living quarters are nailed shut.
Night shift staff are signing the medication logs when it is the day shift staff that administers them.
Correction Narrative: 2 medication records were reviewed. Compliance met

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member has violated the conditions of a background check by administering medications and transporting children in care.
Correction Narrative: I spoke with the Executive Director and he stated he advised the staff member not to touch the medication at all and has assigned other staff the responsibility of transporting. I also spoke with 2 children in care that stated she has not administered them medication and has not transported them anywhere.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the service planned reviewed appeared to be copied and pasted. The verbiage in the service plan does not match the RTC.
Correction Narrative: The Executive Director stated he is unsure how that happened with the service plan, but going forward he will ensure to double check the service plans so that it doesn't happen again.

Deficiency Narrative: After conducting several interviews it was learned that a staff member falls asleep during the night shift.
Correction Narrative: A follow up inspection was conducted on 5/5/2021. Supervision was observed. There were no concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple staff and residents stated that 2 children in care have a habit of running away.
Correction Narrative: I observed supervision during an investigation inspection on 4/14/2021.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver antagonized children in care by using abusive language.
Correction Narrative: I completed an inspection at the operation and spoke with the director. The director stated he is providing additional training to all staff to prevent any situations like this from occurring again.

Deficiency Narrative: During a restraint by a caregiver, a child in care was slammed to the ground and held down on his stomach with his arms behind his back  while the caregiver used her bodyweight to keep the child down, causing the child pain.
Correction Narrative: I completed an inspection at the operation and spoke to the director. He stated he is providing additional EBI training for all staff.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver failed to adhere to the child's rights to be free of abuse, neglect, and exploitation as defined in Texas Family Code 261.401 when the caregiver caused physical harm and injury to a child when performing an improper restraint.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a safety plan and also stated they will provide additional EBI training for all employees.

Deficiency Narrative: The caregivers failed to attempt to de-escalate a situation before performing a restraint on a child in care.
Correction Narrative: I completed an inspection at the operation and spoke to the director. He stated he is providing additional EBI training for all staff.

Deficiency Narrative: The caregiver failed to use the minimal amount of force when slamming the child to the ground causing the child to have an injury under his eye.
Correction Narrative: I completed an inspection at the operation and spoke to the director. He stated he is providing additional EBI training for all staff.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver used corporal punishment on a child when she wrestled with the child and slammed the child to the ground.
Correction Narrative: I completed an inspection at the operation and spoke to the director. He stated he is providing additional EBI training for all staff.

Deficiency Narrative: There is food being stored in the refrigerator that is wrapped and covered in foil. The foil is torn causing the food to not be stored under safe and sanitary conditions.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided pictures of their corrections. It will be uploaded to the digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative: All of the children's records that were reviewed were missing the admission/discharge dates for their previous placements.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided an updated admission assessment that includes the children's previous placement history.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of three staff records reviewed were missing documentation of pre-service training.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided documentation of staff pre-service training.

Deficiency Narrative: Three out of three staff records had training certificates with no hours documented.

Deficiency Narrative: 3 of the 3 staff records reviewed were missing a copy of a cleared TB screening.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided copies of the 3 staff members cleared TB screening.

Deficiency Narrative: All children's records reviewed were missing the birth/neonatal history in their admissions assessment.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided updated copies of the admission assessment which shows the children's birth/neonatal history.

Deficiency Narrative: The medication logs were missing the time the medication was administered.
Correction Narrative: Staff provided documentation of the updated medication logs.

Deficiency Narrative: All 3 staff records reviewed were missing the notarized Licensing Affidavit
Correction Narrative: The operation provided copies of the notarized, signed affidavit.

Deficiency Narrative: All of the children records reviewed were missing the previous school information in their admission assessment.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided updated admission assessment that includes the children's previous school information.

Deficiency Narrative: Two fire extinguishers were observed with loss of operating pressure.

1 of the 3 staff records reviewed was missing documentation stating the employee was exempt from pre-service training.
